\sphinxstylestrong{out} \textendash{} Field with reshaped spatial components.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
{\hyperref[\detokenize{api/field:geology.src.Field}]{\sphinxcrossref{Field}}}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{factors}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#tuple}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{tuple}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#int}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}}) \textendash{} Scale factors along each axis. If int, factors are the same for each axis.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{actnum\_upscale}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#str}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}}) \textendash{} Method to actnum upscaling. If ‘vote’, upscaled cell is active if majority
of finer cells are active. If ‘any’, upscaled cell is active if any
of finer cells is active. Default to ‘vote’.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstylestrong{grid} \textendash{} Upscaled grid.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
{\hyperref[\detokenize{api/grids:geology.src.OrthogonalUniformGrid}]{\sphinxcrossref{OrthogonalUniformGrid}}}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\begin{quote}\begin{description}

Else, properties will be similar to the properties of given dry gas.

\item {}

Modifying the children attribute modifies the tree.

\sphinxstylestrong{Detach}

The children attribute can be updated by setting to an iterable.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{n}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{children} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{a}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{b}\PYG{p}{]}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{n}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{children}
\PYG{g+go}{(Node(\PYGZsq{}/n/a\PYGZsq{}), Node(\PYGZsq{}/n/b\PYGZsq{}))}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

Node \sphinxtitleref{c} is removed from the tree.
In case of an existing reference, the node \sphinxtitleref{c} does not vanish and is the root of its own tree.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{c}
\PYG{g+go}{Node(\PYGZsq{}/c\PYGZsq{})}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxstylestrong{Attach}

\PYG{g+gt}{Traceback (most recent call last):}
    \PYG{o}{.}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{o}{.}
\PYG{g+gr}{anytree.node.exceptions.TreeError}: \PYG{n}{Cannot add node Node(\PYGZsq{}/n/a\PYGZsq{}) multiple times as child.}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\paragraph{SpatialAutoencoder}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/autoencoding:geology.metamodelling.SpatialAutoencoder}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{SpatialAutoencoder}}}{\emph{encoder}, \emph{decoder}, \emph{attr=\textquotesingle{}states\textquotesingle{}}}{}
Spatial autoencoder for States, Rock and Control.
\index{add\_module() (SpatialAutoencoder method)@\spxentry{add\_module()}\spxextra{SpatialAutoencoder method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/autoencoding:geology.metamodelling.SpatialAutoencoder.add_module}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{add\_module}}}{\emph{name}, \emph{module}}{}
Adds a child module to the current module.

The module can be accessed as an attribute using the given name.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{name}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} name of the child module. The child module can be
accessed from this module using the given name

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{module}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Module}}) \textendash{} child module to be added to the module.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{apply() (SpatialAutoencoder method)@\spxentry{apply()}\spxextra{SpatialAutoencoder method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/autoencoding:geology.metamodelling.SpatialAutoencoder.apply}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{apply}}}{\emph{fn}}{}
Applies \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{fn}} recursively to every submodule (as returned by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{.children()}})
as well as self. Typical use includes initializing the parameters of a model
(see also \DUrole{xref,std,std-ref}{torch\sphinxhyphen{}nn\sphinxhyphen{}init}).
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{fn}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Module}} \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{} None) \textendash{} function to be applied to each submodule

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
self

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
Module

\end{description}\end{quote}

Example:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{init\PYGZus{}weights}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{m}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }    \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{m}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }    \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n+nb}{type}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{m}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{==} \PYG{n}{nn}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Linear}\PYG{p}{:}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }        \PYG{n}{m}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{weight}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{data}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{fill\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mf}{1.0}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }        \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{m}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{weight}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{net} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{nn}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Sequential}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{nn}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Linear}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{nn}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Linear}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{net}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{apply}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{init\PYGZus{}weights}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{g+go}{tensor([[ 1.,  1.],}

\PYG{g+go}{Parameter containing:}
\PYG{g+go}{tensor([[ 1.,  1.],}

\index{buffers() (SpatialAutoencoder method)@\spxentry{buffers()}\spxextra{SpatialAutoencoder method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}

Returns an iterator over module buffers.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}

and all submodules. Otherwise, yields only buffers that
are direct members of this module.

\end{description}\end{quote}

\index{cuda() (SpatialAutoencoder method)@\spxentry{cuda()}\spxextra{SpatialAutoencoder method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/autoencoding:geology.metamodelling.SpatialAutoencoder.cuda}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{cuda}}}{\emph{device=None}}{}
Moves all model parameters and buffers to the GPU.

This also makes associated parameters and buffers different objects. So
it should be called before constructing optimizer if the module will
live on GPU while being optimized.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{device}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#int}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} if specified, all parameters will be
copied to that device

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
self

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
Module

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{eval() (SpatialAutoencoder method)@\spxentry{eval()}\spxextra{SpatialAutoencoder method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/autoencoding:geology.metamodelling.SpatialAutoencoder.eval}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{eval}}}{}{}
Sets the module in evaluation mode.

This has any effect only on certain modules. See documentations of
particular modules for details of their behaviors in training/evaluation
mode, if they are affected, e.g. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Dropout}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{BatchNorm}},
etc.

This is equivalent with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{self.train(False)}}.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
self

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
Module

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{extra\_repr() (SpatialAutoencoder method)@\spxentry{extra\_repr()}\spxextra{SpatialAutoencoder method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/autoencoding:geology.metamodelling.SpatialAutoencoder.extra_repr}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{extra\_repr}}}{}{}
Set the extra representation of the module

To print customized extra information, you should reimplement
this method in your own modules. Both single\sphinxhyphen{}line and multi\sphinxhyphen{}line
strings are acceptable.

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{float() (SpatialAutoencoder method)@\spxentry{float()}\spxextra{SpatialAutoencoder method}}

\index{modules() (SpatialAutoencoder method)@\spxentry{modules()}\spxextra{SpatialAutoencoder method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/autoencoding:geology.metamodelling.SpatialAutoencoder.modules}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{modules}}}{}{}
Returns an iterator over all modules in the network.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Yields}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleemphasis{Module} \textendash{} a module in the network

\end{description}\end{quote}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
Duplicate modules are returned only once. In the following
example, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{l}} will be returned only once.
\end{sphinxadmonition}

Example:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{l} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{nn}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Linear}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{net} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{nn}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Sequential}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{l}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{l}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{k}{for} \PYG{n}{idx}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{m} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n+nb}{enumerate}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{net}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{modules}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
\PYG{g+go}{        print(idx, \PYGZsq{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZsq{}, m)}

\PYG{g+go}{0 \PYGZhy{}\PYGZgt{} Sequential(}
\PYG{g+go}{  (0): Linear(in\PYGZus{}features=2, out\PYGZus{}features=2, bias=True)}
\PYG{g+go}{  (1): Linear(in\PYGZus{}features=2, out\PYGZus{}features=2, bias=True)}
\PYG{g+go}{)}
\PYG{g+go}{1 \PYGZhy{}\PYGZgt{} Linear(in\PYGZus{}features=2, out\PYGZus{}features=2, bias=True)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{named\_buffers() (SpatialAutoencoder method)@\spxentry{named\_buffers()}\spxextra{SpatialAutoencoder method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/autoencoding:geology.metamodelling.SpatialAutoencoder.named_buffers}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{named\_buffers}}}{\emph{prefix=\textquotesingle{}\textquotesingle{}}, \emph{recurse=True}}{}
Returns an iterator over module buffers, yielding both the
name of the buffer as well as the buffer itself.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{prefix}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#str}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}}) \textendash{} prefix to prepend to all buffer names.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{recurse}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#bool}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}}) \textendash{} if True, then yields buffers of this module
and all submodules. Otherwise, yields only buffers that
are direct members of this module.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Yields}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleemphasis{(string, torch.Tensor)} \textendash{} Tuple containing the name and buffer

\end{description}\end{quote}

Example:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{k}{for} \PYG{n}{name}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{buf} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{named\PYGZus{}buffers}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }   \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{name} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{running\PYGZus{}var}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{:}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }       \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{buf}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{size}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{named\_parameters() (SpatialAutoencoder method)@\spxentry{named\_parameters()}\spxextra{SpatialAutoencoder method}}

\index{parameters() (SpatialAutoencoder method)@\spxentry{parameters()}\spxextra{SpatialAutoencoder method}}

Returns an iterator over module parameters.

This is typically passed to an optimizer.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{recurse}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#bool}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}}) \textendash{} if True, then yields parameters of this module
and all submodules. Otherwise, yields only parameters that
are direct members of this module.

\end{description}\end{quote}

Example:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }    \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb}{type}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{param}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{data}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{param}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{size}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+go}{\PYGZlt{}class \PYGZsq{}torch.FloatTensor\PYGZsq{}\PYGZgt{} (20L,)}
\PYG{g+go}{\PYGZlt{}class \PYGZsq{}torch.FloatTensor\PYGZsq{}\PYGZgt{} (20L, 1L, 5L, 5L)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{register\_backward\_hook() (SpatialAutoencoder method)@\spxentry{register\_backward\_hook()}\spxextra{SpatialAutoencoder method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/autoencoding:geology.metamodelling.SpatialAutoencoder.register_backward_hook}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{register\_backward\_hook}}}{\emph{hook}}{}
Registers a backward hook on the module.

The hook will be called every time the gradients with respect to module
inputs are computed. The hook should have the following signature:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{hook}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{module}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{grad\PYGZus{}input}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{grad\PYGZus{}output}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}} \PYG{n}{Tensor} \PYG{o+ow}{or} \PYG{k+kc}{None}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

The \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{grad\_input}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{grad\_output}} may be tuples if the
module has multiple inputs or outputs. The hook should not modify its
arguments, but it can optionally return a new gradient with respect to
input that will be used in place of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{grad\_input}} in subsequent
computations.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
a handle that can be used to remove the added hook by calling
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{handle.remove()}}

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{torch.utils.hooks.RemovableHandle}}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{warning}{Warning:}
The current implementation will not have the presented behavior
for complex \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Module}} that perform many operations.
In some failure cases, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{grad\_input}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{grad\_output}} will only
contain the gradients for a subset of the inputs and outputs.
For such \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Module}}, you should use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{torch.Tensor.register\_hook()}}
directly on a specific input or output to get the required gradients.
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{register\_buffer() (SpatialAutoencoder method)@\spxentry{register\_buffer()}\spxextra{SpatialAutoencoder method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/autoencoding:geology.metamodelling.SpatialAutoencoder.register_buffer}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{register\_buffer}}}{\emph{name}, \emph{tensor}}{}
Adds a persistent buffer to the module.

This is typically used to register a buffer that should not to be
considered a model parameter. For example, BatchNorm’s \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{running\_mean}}
is not a parameter, but is part of the persistent state.

Buffers can be accessed as attributes using given names.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{name}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} name of the buffer. The buffer can be accessed
from this module using the given name

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{tensor}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Tensor}}) \textendash{} buffer to be registered.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

Example:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{register\PYGZus{}buffer}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{running\PYGZus{}mean}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{torch}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{zeros}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{num\PYGZus{}features}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{register\_forward\_hook() (SpatialAutoencoder method)@\spxentry{register\_forward\_hook()}\spxextra{SpatialAutoencoder method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/autoencoding:geology.metamodelling.SpatialAutoencoder.register_forward_hook}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{register\_forward\_hook}}}{\emph{hook}}{}
Registers a forward hook on the module.

The hook will be called every time after {\hyperref[\detokenize{api/autoencoding:geology.metamodelling.SpatialAutoencoder.forward}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{forward()}}}}} has computed an output.
It should have the following signature:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{hook}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{module}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n+nb}{input}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{output}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}} \PYG{k+kc}{None} \PYG{o+ow}{or} \PYG{n}{modified} \PYG{n}{output}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

The hook can modify the output. It can modify the input inplace but
it will not have effect on forward since this is called after
{\hyperref[\detokenize{api/autoencoding:geology.metamodelling.SpatialAutoencoder.forward}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{forward()}}}}} is called.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
a handle that can be used to remove the added hook by calling
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{handle.remove()}}

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{torch.utils.hooks.RemovableHandle}}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{register\_forward\_pre\_hook() (SpatialAutoencoder method)@\spxentry{register\_forward\_pre\_hook()}\spxextra{SpatialAutoencoder method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/autoencoding:geology.metamodelling.SpatialAutoencoder.register_forward_pre_hook}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{register\_forward\_pre\_hook}}}{\emph{hook}}{}
Registers a forward pre\sphinxhyphen{}hook on the module.

The hook will be called every time before {\hyperref[\detokenize{api/autoencoding:geology.metamodelling.SpatialAutoencoder.forward}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{forward()}}}}} is invoked.
It should have the following signature:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{hook}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{module}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n+nb}{input}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}} \PYG{k+kc}{None} \PYG{o+ow}{or} \PYG{n}{modified} \PYG{n+nb}{input}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

The hook can modify the input. User can either return a tuple or a
single modified value in the hook. We will wrap the value into a tuple
if a single value is returned(unless that value is already a tuple).
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
a handle that can be used to remove the added hook by calling
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{handle.remove()}}

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{torch.utils.hooks.RemovableHandle}}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

from this module using the given name

module.

\index{to() (SpatialAutoencoder method)@\spxentry{to()}\spxextra{SpatialAutoencoder method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/autoencoding:geology.metamodelling.SpatialAutoencoder.to}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{to}}}{\emph{*args}, \emph{**kwargs}}{}
Moves and/or casts the parameters and buffers.

This can be called as
\index{SpatialAutoencoder.to() (in module geology.metamodelling)@\spxentry{SpatialAutoencoder.to()}\spxextra{in module geology.metamodelling}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{to}}}{\emph{device=None}, \emph{dtype=None}, \emph{non\_blocking=False}}{}
\end{fulllineitems}

\index{SpatialAutoencoder.to() (in module geology.metamodelling)@\spxentry{SpatialAutoencoder.to()}\spxextra{in module geology.metamodelling}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{to}}}{\emph{dtype}, \emph{non\_blocking=False}}{}
\end{fulllineitems}

\index{SpatialAutoencoder.to() (in module geology.metamodelling)@\spxentry{SpatialAutoencoder.to()}\spxextra{in module geology.metamodelling}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{to}}}{\emph{tensor}, \emph{non\_blocking=False}}{}
\end{fulllineitems}


Its signature is similar to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{torch.Tensor.to()}}, but only accepts
floating point desired \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{dtype}} s. In addition, this method will
only cast the floating point parameters and buffers to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{dtype}}
(if given). The integral parameters and buffers will be moved
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{device}}, if that is given, but with dtypes unchanged. When
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{non\_blocking}} is set, it tries to convert/move asynchronously
with respect to the host if possible, e.g., moving CPU Tensors with
pinned memory to CUDA devices.

See below for examples.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
This method modifies the module in\sphinxhyphen{}place.
\end{sphinxadmonition}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{device}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{torch.device}}) \textendash{} the desired device of the parameters
and buffers in this module

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{dtype}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{torch.dtype}}) \textendash{} the desired floating point type of
the floating point parameters and buffers in this module

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{tensor}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{torch.Tensor}}) \textendash{} Tensor whose dtype and device are the desired
dtype and device for all parameters and buffers in this module

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
self

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
Module

\end{description}\end{quote}

Example:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{linear} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{nn}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Linear}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{linear}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{weight}
\PYG{g+go}{Parameter containing:}
\PYG{g+go}{tensor([[ 0.1913, \PYGZhy{}0.3420],}
\PYG{g+go}{        [\PYGZhy{}0.5113, \PYGZhy{}0.2325]])}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{linear}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{to}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{torch}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{double}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+go}{Linear(in\PYGZus{}features=2, out\PYGZus{}features=2, bias=True)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{linear}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{weight}
\PYG{g+go}{Parameter containing:}

\PYG{g+go}{        [\PYGZhy{}0.5113, \PYGZhy{}0.2325]], dtype=torch.float64)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{gpu1} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{torch}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{device}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{cuda:1}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{linear}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{to}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{gpu1}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{dtype}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{torch}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{half}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{non\PYGZus{}blocking}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{k+kc}{True}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{g+go}{        [\PYGZhy{}0.5112, \PYGZhy{}0.2324]], dtype=torch.float16, device=\PYGZsq{}cuda:1\PYGZsq{})}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{cpu} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{torch}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{device}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{cpu}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}

\index{apply() (NeuralDifferentialEquation method)@\spxentry{apply()}\spxextra{NeuralDifferentialEquation method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/dynamics:geology.metamodelling.dynamics.NeuralDifferentialEquation.apply}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{apply}}}{\emph{fn}}{}
Applies \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{fn}} recursively to every submodule (as returned by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{.children()}})
as well as self. Typical use includes initializing the parameters of a model
(see also \DUrole{xref,std,std-ref}{torch\sphinxhyphen{}nn\sphinxhyphen{}init}).
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{fn}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Module}} \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{} None) \textendash{} function to be applied to each submodule

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
self

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
Module

\end{description}\end{quote}

\index{buffers() (NeuralDifferentialEquation method)@\spxentry{buffers()}\spxextra{NeuralDifferentialEquation method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/dynamics:geology.metamodelling.dynamics.NeuralDifferentialEquation.buffers}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{buffers}}}{\emph{recurse=True}}{}
Returns an iterator over module buffers.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{recurse}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#bool}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}}) \textendash{} if True, then yields buffers of this module
and all submodules. Otherwise, yields only buffers that
are direct members of this module.

\item[{Yields}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleemphasis{torch.Tensor} \textendash{} module buffer

\end{description}\end{quote}

Example:

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/dynamics:geology.metamodelling.dynamics.NeuralDifferentialEquation.forward}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{forward}}}{\emph{init\_state}, \emph{params}, \emph{control}, \emph{control\_t}, \emph{t}, \emph{*der\_args}, \emph{max\_integration\_timestep=100}, \emph{solver=\textquotesingle{}rk4\textquotesingle{}}, \emph{rtol=0.0001}, \emph{atol=0.0001}, \emph{use\_adjoint=False}, \emph{max\_seq\_len=None}, \emph{use\_outer\_checkpointing=False}, \emph{use\_inner\_checkpointing=True}, \emph{**der\_kwargs}}{}~\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{init\_state}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{torch.Tensor}}) \textendash{} Initial state. Shape: (B, C\_s, {\color{red}\bfseries{}*}dims)

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{params}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{torch.Tensor}}) \textendash{} Params tensor (rock mostly). Shape: (B, C\_p, {\color{red}\bfseries{}*}dims)

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{control}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{torch.Tensor}}) \textendash{} Spatial control tensor. Shape: (B, T, C\_c, {\color{red}\bfseries{}*}dims)

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{control\_t}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{torch.Tensor}}) \textendash{} Tensor holding a sequence of time points for which control is given.
Each time must be strictly larger than the previous time. Shape: (B, T\_c)

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{t}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{torch.Tensor}}) \textendash{} Tensor holding a sequence of time points for which to solve for states.
The initial time point (i.e. time point of the init\_state) should be the first
element of this sequence, and each time must be strictly larger than the previous time.
Shape: (B, T)

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{der\_args}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#tuple}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{tuple}}}) \textendash{} Any additional args passed to the dynamics module.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{max\_integration\_timestep}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#int}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}}) \textendash{} Maximal timestep can be made internally by the solver.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{solver}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#str}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}}) \textendash{} 
Name of the solver to use. From the list:
{[}
\begin{quote}

’explicit\_adams’,
‘fixed\_adams’,
‘adams’,
‘tsit5’,
‘dopri5’,
‘euler’,
‘midpoint’,
‘rk4’,
‘adaptive\_heun’,
\end{quote}

{]}


\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{rtol}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#float}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}}) \textendash{} Relative tolerance.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{atol}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#float}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}}) \textendash{} Absolute tolerance.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{use\_adjoint}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#bool}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}}) \textendash{} If True, use Adjoint method at the backward pass.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{max\_seq\_len}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#int}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}}) \textendash{} Maximal lenght of the sequence, that can be passed into single forward pass.
If required solution has a greater length, several forward passes will be done.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{use\_outer\_checkpointing}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#bool}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}}) \textendash{} If True, decorates the Integrator class with CheckpointWrapper. Default: False.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{use\_inner\_checkpointing}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#bool}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}}) \textendash{} If True, wraps individual forward passes of length \sphinxtitleref{max\_seq\_len} with CheckpointWrapper. Default: True.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{der\_kwargs}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#dict}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{dict}}}) \textendash{} Any additional named arguments passed to the \sphinxtitleref{time\_derivative\_module}.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstylestrong{solution} \textendash{} Predicted states. Shape: (B, T, C\_s, {\color{red}\bfseries{}*}dims)

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
torch.Tensor

\end{description}\end{quote}

\index{modules() (NeuralDifferentialEquation method)@\spxentry{modules()}\spxextra{NeuralDifferentialEquation method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/dynamics:geology.metamodelling.dynamics.NeuralDifferentialEquation.modules}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{modules}}}{}{}
Returns an iterator over all modules in the network.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Yields}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleemphasis{Module} \textendash{} a module in the network

\end{description}\end{quote}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
Duplicate modules are returned only once. In the following
example, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{l}} will be returned only once.
\end{sphinxadmonition}

Example:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{l} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{nn}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Linear}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{net} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{nn}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Sequential}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{l}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{l}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{k}{for} \PYG{n}{idx}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{m} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n+nb}{enumerate}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{net}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{modules}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
\PYG{g+go}{        print(idx, \PYGZsq{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZsq{}, m)}

\PYG{g+go}{0 \PYGZhy{}\PYGZgt{} Sequential(}
\PYG{g+go}{  (0): Linear(in\PYGZus{}features=2, out\PYGZus{}features=2, bias=True)}
\PYG{g+go}{  (1): Linear(in\PYGZus{}features=2, out\PYGZus{}features=2, bias=True)}
\PYG{g+go}{)}
\PYG{g+go}{1 \PYGZhy{}\PYGZgt{} Linear(in\PYGZus{}features=2, out\PYGZus{}features=2, bias=True)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{named\_buffers() (NeuralDifferentialEquation method)@\spxentry{named\_buffers()}\spxextra{NeuralDifferentialEquation method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/dynamics:geology.metamodelling.dynamics.NeuralDifferentialEquation.named_buffers}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{named\_buffers}}}{\emph{prefix=\textquotesingle{}\textquotesingle{}}, \emph{recurse=True}}{}
Returns an iterator over module buffers, yielding both the
name of the buffer as well as the buffer itself.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{prefix}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#str}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}}) \textendash{} prefix to prepend to all buffer names.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{recurse}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#bool}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}}) \textendash{} if True, then yields buffers of this module
and all submodules. Otherwise, yields only buffers that
are direct members of this module.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Yields}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleemphasis{(string, torch.Tensor)} \textendash{} Tuple containing the name and buffer

\end{description}\end{quote}

Example:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{k}{for} \PYG{n}{name}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{buf} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{named\PYGZus{}buffers}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }   \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{name} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{running\PYGZus{}var}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{:}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }       \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{buf}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{size}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{named\_modules() (NeuralDifferentialEquation method)@\spxentry{named\_modules()}\spxextra{NeuralDifferentialEquation method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/dynamics:geology.metamodelling.dynamics.NeuralDifferentialEquation.named_modules}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{named\_modules}}}{\emph{memo=None}, \emph{prefix=\textquotesingle{}\textquotesingle{}}}{}
Returns an iterator over all modules in the network, yielding
both the name of the module as well as the module itself.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Yields}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleemphasis{(string, Module)} \textendash{} Tuple of name and module

Example:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

\index{named\_parameters() (NeuralDifferentialEquation method)@\spxentry{named\_parameters()}\spxextra{NeuralDifferentialEquation method}}

and all submodules. Otherwise, yields only parameters that
are direct members of this module.

\index{register\_backward\_hook() (NeuralDifferentialEquation method)@\spxentry{register\_backward\_hook()}\spxextra{NeuralDifferentialEquation method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/dynamics:geology.metamodelling.dynamics.NeuralDifferentialEquation.register_backward_hook}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{register\_backward\_hook}}}{\emph{hook}}{}
Registers a backward hook on the module.

The hook will be called every time the gradients with respect to module
inputs are computed. The hook should have the following signature:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{hook}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{module}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{grad\PYGZus{}input}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{grad\PYGZus{}output}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}} \PYG{n}{Tensor} \PYG{o+ow}{or} \PYG{k+kc}{None}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

The \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{grad\_input}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{grad\_output}} may be tuples if the
module has multiple inputs or outputs. The hook should not modify its
arguments, but it can optionally return a new gradient with respect to
input that will be used in place of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{grad\_input}} in subsequent
computations.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
a handle that can be used to remove the added hook by calling
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{handle.remove()}}

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{torch.utils.hooks.RemovableHandle}}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{warning}{Warning:}
The current implementation will not have the presented behavior
for complex \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Module}} that perform many operations.
In some failure cases, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{grad\_input}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{grad\_output}} will only
contain the gradients for a subset of the inputs and outputs.
For such \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Module}}, you should use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{torch.Tensor.register\_hook()}}
directly on a specific input or output to get the required gradients.
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{register\_buffer() (NeuralDifferentialEquation method)@\spxentry{register\_buffer()}\spxextra{NeuralDifferentialEquation method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/dynamics:geology.metamodelling.dynamics.NeuralDifferentialEquation.register_buffer}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{register\_buffer}}}{\emph{name}, \emph{tensor}}{}
Adds a persistent buffer to the module.

This is typically used to register a buffer that should not to be
considered a model parameter. For example, BatchNorm’s \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{running\_mean}}
is not a parameter, but is part of the persistent state.

Buffers can be accessed as attributes using given names.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{name}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} name of the buffer. The buffer can be accessed
from this module using the given name

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{tensor}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Tensor}}) \textendash{} buffer to be registered.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

Example:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{register\PYGZus{}buffer}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{running\PYGZus{}mean}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{torch}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{zeros}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{num\PYGZus{}features}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{register\_forward\_hook() (NeuralDifferentialEquation method)@\spxentry{register\_forward\_hook()}\spxextra{NeuralDifferentialEquation method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/dynamics:geology.metamodelling.dynamics.NeuralDifferentialEquation.register_forward_hook}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{register\_forward\_hook}}}{\emph{hook}}{}
Registers a forward hook on the module.

The hook will be called every time after {\hyperref[\detokenize{api/dynamics:geology.metamodelling.dynamics.NeuralDifferentialEquation.forward}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{forward()}}}}} has computed an output.
It should have the following signature:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{hook}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{module}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n+nb}{input}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{output}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}} \PYG{k+kc}{None} \PYG{o+ow}{or} \PYG{n}{modified} \PYG{n}{output}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

The hook can modify the output. It can modify the input inplace but
it will not have effect on forward since this is called after
{\hyperref[\detokenize{api/dynamics:geology.metamodelling.dynamics.NeuralDifferentialEquation.forward}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{forward()}}}}} is called.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
a handle that can be used to remove the added hook by calling
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{handle.remove()}}

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{torch.utils.hooks.RemovableHandle}}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{register\_forward\_pre\_hook() (NeuralDifferentialEquation method)@\spxentry{register\_forward\_pre\_hook()}\spxextra{NeuralDifferentialEquation method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/dynamics:geology.metamodelling.dynamics.NeuralDifferentialEquation.register_forward_pre_hook}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{register\_forward\_pre\_hook}}}{\emph{hook}}{}
Registers a forward pre\sphinxhyphen{}hook on the module.

The hook will be called every time before {\hyperref[\detokenize{api/dynamics:geology.metamodelling.dynamics.NeuralDifferentialEquation.forward}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{forward()}}}}} is invoked.
It should have the following signature:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{hook}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{module}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n+nb}{input}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}} \PYG{k+kc}{None} \PYG{o+ow}{or} \PYG{n}{modified} \PYG{n+nb}{input}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

The hook can modify the input. User can either return a tuple or a
single modified value in the hook. We will wrap the value into a tuple
if a single value is returned(unless that value is already a tuple).
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
a handle that can be used to remove the added hook by calling
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{handle.remove()}}

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{torch.utils.hooks.RemovableHandle}}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\index{to() (NeuralDifferentialEquation method)@\spxentry{to()}\spxextra{NeuralDifferentialEquation method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/dynamics:geology.metamodelling.dynamics.NeuralDifferentialEquation.to}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{to}}}{\emph{*args}, \emph{**kwargs}}{}
Moves and/or casts the parameters and buffers.

This can be called as
\index{NeuralDifferentialEquation.to() (in module geology.metamodelling.dynamics)@\spxentry{NeuralDifferentialEquation.to()}\spxextra{in module geology.metamodelling.dynamics}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{to}}}{\emph{device=None}, \emph{dtype=None}, \emph{non\_blocking=False}}{}
\end{fulllineitems}

\index{NeuralDifferentialEquation.to() (in module geology.metamodelling.dynamics)@\spxentry{NeuralDifferentialEquation.to()}\spxextra{in module geology.metamodelling.dynamics}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{to}}}{\emph{dtype}, \emph{non\_blocking=False}}{}
\end{fulllineitems}

\index{NeuralDifferentialEquation.to() (in module geology.metamodelling.dynamics)@\spxentry{NeuralDifferentialEquation.to()}\spxextra{in module geology.metamodelling.dynamics}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{to}}}{\emph{tensor}, \emph{non\_blocking=False}}{}
\end{fulllineitems}


Its signature is similar to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{torch.Tensor.to()}}, but only accepts
floating point desired \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{dtype}} s. In addition, this method will
only cast the floating point parameters and buffers to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{dtype}}
(if given). The integral parameters and buffers will be moved
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{device}}, if that is given, but with dtypes unchanged. When
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{non\_blocking}} is set, it tries to convert/move asynchronously
with respect to the host if possible, e.g., moving CPU Tensors with
pinned memory to CUDA devices.

See below for examples.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
This method modifies the module in\sphinxhyphen{}place.
\end{sphinxadmonition}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{device}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{torch.device}}) \textendash{} the desired device of the parameters
and buffers in this module

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{dtype}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{torch.dtype}}) \textendash{} the desired floating point type of
the floating point parameters and buffers in this module

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{tensor}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{torch.Tensor}}) \textendash{} Tensor whose dtype and device are the desired
dtype and device for all parameters and buffers in this module

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
self

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
Module

\end{description}\end{quote}

Example:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{linear} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{nn}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Linear}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{linear}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{weight}
\PYG{g+go}{Parameter containing:}
\PYG{g+go}{tensor([[ 0.1913, \PYGZhy{}0.3420],}
\PYG{g+go}{        [\PYGZhy{}0.5113, \PYGZhy{}0.2325]])}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{linear}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{to}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{torch}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{double}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+go}{Linear(in\PYGZus{}features=2, out\PYGZus{}features=2, bias=True)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{linear}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{weight}
\PYG{g+go}{Parameter containing:}
\PYG{g+go}{tensor([[ 0.1913, \PYGZhy{}0.3420],}
\PYG{g+go}{        [\PYGZhy{}0.5113, \PYGZhy{}0.2325]], dtype=torch.float64)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{gpu1} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{torch}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{device}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{cuda:1}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{linear}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{to}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{gpu1}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{dtype}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{torch}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{half}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{non\PYGZus{}blocking}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{k+kc}{True}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{g+go}{        [\PYGZhy{}0.5112, \PYGZhy{}0.2324]], dtype=torch.float16, device=\PYGZsq{}cuda:1\PYGZsq{})}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{cpu} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{torch}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{device}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{cpu}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}

\index{train() (NeuralDifferentialEquation method)@\spxentry{train()}\spxextra{NeuralDifferentialEquation method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/dynamics:geology.metamodelling.dynamics.NeuralDifferentialEquation.train}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{train}}}{\emph{mode=True}}{}
Sets the module in training mode.

This has any effect only on certain modules. See documentations of
particular modules for details of their behaviors in training/evaluation
mode, if they are affected, e.g. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Dropout}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{BatchNorm}},
etc.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{mode}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#bool}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}}) \textendash{} whether to set training mode (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{True}}) or evaluation
mode (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{False}}). Default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{True}}.

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
Module

\end{description}\end{quote}

\index{apply() (LatentSpaceDynamics method)@\spxentry{apply()}\spxextra{LatentSpaceDynamics method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/dynamics:geology.metamodelling.dynamics.LatentSpaceDynamics.apply}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{apply}}}{\emph{fn}}{}
Applies \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{fn}} recursively to every submodule (as returned by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{.children()}})
as well as self. Typical use includes initializing the parameters of a model
(see also \DUrole{xref,std,std-ref}{torch\sphinxhyphen{}nn\sphinxhyphen{}init}).
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{fn}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Module}} \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{} None) \textendash{} function to be applied to each submodule

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
self

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
Module

\end{description}\end{quote}

Copies parameters and buffers from {\hyperref[\detokenize{api/dynamics:geology.metamodelling.dynamics.LatentSpaceDynamics.state_dict}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{state\_dict}}}}} into

persistent buffers.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{strict}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#bool}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} whether to strictly enforce that the keys
in {\hyperref[\detokenize{api/dynamics:geology.metamodelling.dynamics.LatentSpaceDynamics.state_dict}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{state\_dict}}}}} match the keys returned by this module’s
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{state\_dict()}} function. Default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{True}}

\item {}

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/dynamics:geology.metamodelling.dynamics.LatentSpaceDynamics.modules}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{modules}}}{}{}
Returns an iterator over all modules in the network.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Yields}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleemphasis{Module} \textendash{} a module in the network

\end{description}\end{quote}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
Duplicate modules are returned only once. In the following
example, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{l}} will be returned only once.
\end{sphinxadmonition}

Example:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{l} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{nn}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Linear}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{net} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{nn}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Sequential}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{l}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{l}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{k}{for} \PYG{n}{idx}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{m} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n+nb}{enumerate}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{net}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{modules}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
\PYG{g+go}{        print(idx, \PYGZsq{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZsq{}, m)}

\PYG{g+go}{0 \PYGZhy{}\PYGZgt{} Sequential(}
\PYG{g+go}{  (0): Linear(in\PYGZus{}features=2, out\PYGZus{}features=2, bias=True)}
\PYG{g+go}{  (1): Linear(in\PYGZus{}features=2, out\PYGZus{}features=2, bias=True)}
\PYG{g+go}{)}
\PYG{g+go}{1 \PYGZhy{}\PYGZgt{} Linear(in\PYGZus{}features=2, out\PYGZus{}features=2, bias=True)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{register\_backward\_hook() (LatentSpaceDynamics method)@\spxentry{register\_backward\_hook()}\spxextra{LatentSpaceDynamics method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/dynamics:geology.metamodelling.dynamics.LatentSpaceDynamics.register_backward_hook}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{register\_backward\_hook}}}{\emph{hook}}{}
Registers a backward hook on the module.

The hook will be called every time the gradients with respect to module
inputs are computed. The hook should have the following signature:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{hook}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{module}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{grad\PYGZus{}input}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{grad\PYGZus{}output}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}} \PYG{n}{Tensor} \PYG{o+ow}{or} \PYG{k+kc}{None}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

The \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{grad\_input}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{grad\_output}} may be tuples if the
module has multiple inputs or outputs. The hook should not modify its
arguments, but it can optionally return a new gradient with respect to
input that will be used in place of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{grad\_input}} in subsequent
computations.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
a handle that can be used to remove the added hook by calling
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{handle.remove()}}

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{torch.utils.hooks.RemovableHandle}}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{warning}{Warning:}
The current implementation will not have the presented behavior
for complex \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Module}} that perform many operations.
In some failure cases, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{grad\_input}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{grad\_output}} will only
contain the gradients for a subset of the inputs and outputs.
For such \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Module}}, you should use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{torch.Tensor.register\_hook()}}
directly on a specific input or output to get the required gradients.
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{register\_buffer() (LatentSpaceDynamics method)@\spxentry{register\_buffer()}\spxextra{LatentSpaceDynamics method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/dynamics:geology.metamodelling.dynamics.LatentSpaceDynamics.register_buffer}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{register\_buffer}}}{\emph{name}, \emph{tensor}}{}
Adds a persistent buffer to the module.

This is typically used to register a buffer that should not to be
considered a model parameter. For example, BatchNorm’s \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{running\_mean}}
is not a parameter, but is part of the persistent state.

Buffers can be accessed as attributes using given names.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{name}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} name of the buffer. The buffer can be accessed
from this module using the given name

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{tensor}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Tensor}}) \textendash{} buffer to be registered.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

Example:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{register\PYGZus{}buffer}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{running\PYGZus{}mean}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{torch}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{zeros}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{num\PYGZus{}features}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{register\_forward\_hook() (LatentSpaceDynamics method)@\spxentry{register\_forward\_hook()}\spxextra{LatentSpaceDynamics method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/dynamics:geology.metamodelling.dynamics.LatentSpaceDynamics.register_forward_hook}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{register\_forward\_hook}}}{\emph{hook}}{}
Registers a forward hook on the module.

The hook will be called every time after {\hyperref[\detokenize{api/dynamics:geology.metamodelling.dynamics.LatentSpaceDynamics.forward}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{forward()}}}}} has computed an output.
It should have the following signature:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{hook}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{module}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n+nb}{input}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{output}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}} \PYG{k+kc}{None} \PYG{o+ow}{or} \PYG{n}{modified} \PYG{n}{output}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

The hook can modify the output. It can modify the input inplace but
it will not have effect on forward since this is called after
{\hyperref[\detokenize{api/dynamics:geology.metamodelling.dynamics.LatentSpaceDynamics.forward}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{forward()}}}}} is called.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
a handle that can be used to remove the added hook by calling
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{handle.remove()}}

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{torch.utils.hooks.RemovableHandle}}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{register\_forward\_pre\_hook() (LatentSpaceDynamics method)@\spxentry{register\_forward\_pre\_hook()}\spxextra{LatentSpaceDynamics method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/dynamics:geology.metamodelling.dynamics.LatentSpaceDynamics.register_forward_pre_hook}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{register\_forward\_pre\_hook}}}{\emph{hook}}{}
Registers a forward pre\sphinxhyphen{}hook on the module.

The hook will be called every time before {\hyperref[\detokenize{api/dynamics:geology.metamodelling.dynamics.LatentSpaceDynamics.forward}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{forward()}}}}} is invoked.
It should have the following signature:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{hook}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{module}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n+nb}{input}\PYG{p}{)} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}} \PYG{k+kc}{None} \PYG{o+ow}{or} \PYG{n}{modified} \PYG{n+nb}{input}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

The hook can modify the input. User can either return a tuple or a
single modified value in the hook. We will wrap the value into a tuple
if a single value is returned(unless that value is already a tuple).
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
a handle that can be used to remove the added hook by calling
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{handle.remove()}}

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{torch.utils.hooks.RemovableHandle}}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/dynamics:geology.metamodelling.dynamics.LatentSpaceDynamics.register_parameter}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{register\_parameter}}}{\emph{name}, \emph{param}}{}
Adds a parameter to the module.

from this module using the given name

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{param}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Parameter}}) \textendash{} parameter to be added to the module.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{requires\_grad\_() (LatentSpaceDynamics method)@\spxentry{requires\_grad\_()}\spxextra{LatentSpaceDynamics method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/dynamics:geology.metamodelling.dynamics.LatentSpaceDynamics.requires_grad_}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{requires\_grad\_}}}{\emph{requires\_grad=True}}{}
Change if autograd should record operations on parameters in this
module.

This method sets the parameters’ \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{requires\_grad}} attributes
in\sphinxhyphen{}place.

This method is helpful for freezing part of the module for finetuning
or training parts of a model individually (e.g., GAN training).
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{requires\_grad}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#bool}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}}) \textendash{} whether autograd should record operations on
parameters in this module. Default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{True}}.

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
self

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
Module

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\begin{fulllineitems}

Both parameters and persistent buffers (e.g. running averages) are
included. Keys are corresponding parameter and buffer names.

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{to() (LatentSpaceDynamics method)@\spxentry{to()}\spxextra{LatentSpaceDynamics method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/dynamics:geology.metamodelling.dynamics.LatentSpaceDynamics.to}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{to}}}{\emph{*args}, \emph{**kwargs}}{}
Moves and/or casts the parameters and buffers.

This can be called as
\index{LatentSpaceDynamics.to() (in module geology.metamodelling.dynamics)@\spxentry{LatentSpaceDynamics.to()}\spxextra{in module geology.metamodelling.dynamics}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{to}}}{\emph{device=None}, \emph{dtype=None}, \emph{non\_blocking=False}}{}
\end{fulllineitems}

\index{LatentSpaceDynamics.to() (in module geology.metamodelling.dynamics)@\spxentry{LatentSpaceDynamics.to()}\spxextra{in module geology.metamodelling.dynamics}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{to}}}{\emph{dtype}, \emph{non\_blocking=False}}{}
\end{fulllineitems}

\index{LatentSpaceDynamics.to() (in module geology.metamodelling.dynamics)@\spxentry{LatentSpaceDynamics.to()}\spxextra{in module geology.metamodelling.dynamics}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{to}}}{\emph{tensor}, \emph{non\_blocking=False}}{}
\end{fulllineitems}


Its signature is similar to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{torch.Tensor.to()}}, but only accepts
floating point desired \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{dtype}} s. In addition, this method will
only cast the floating point parameters and buffers to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{dtype}}
(if given). The integral parameters and buffers will be moved
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{device}}, if that is given, but with dtypes unchanged. When
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{non\_blocking}} is set, it tries to convert/move asynchronously
with respect to the host if possible, e.g., moving CPU Tensors with
pinned memory to CUDA devices.

See below for examples.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
This method modifies the module in\sphinxhyphen{}place.
\end{sphinxadmonition}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{device}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{torch.device}}) \textendash{} the desired device of the parameters
and buffers in this module

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{dtype}} (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{torch.dtype}}) \textendash{} the desired floating point type of
the floating point parameters and buffers in this module

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{tensor}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{torch.Tensor}}) \textendash{} Tensor whose dtype and device are the desired
dtype and device for all parameters and buffers in this module

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
self

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
Module

\end{description}\end{quote}

Example:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{linear} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{nn}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{Linear}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{linear}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{weight}
\PYG{g+go}{Parameter containing:}
\PYG{g+go}{tensor([[ 0.1913, \PYGZhy{}0.3420],}
\PYG{g+go}{        [\PYGZhy{}0.5113, \PYGZhy{}0.2325]])}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{linear}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{to}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{torch}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{double}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+go}{Linear(in\PYGZus{}features=2, out\PYGZus{}features=2, bias=True)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{linear}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{weight}
\PYG{g+go}{Parameter containing:}
\PYG{g+go}{tensor([[ 0.1913, \PYGZhy{}0.3420],}
\PYG{g+go}{        [\PYGZhy{}0.5113, \PYGZhy{}0.2325]], dtype=torch.float64)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{gpu1} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{torch}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{device}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{cuda:1}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{linear}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{to}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{gpu1}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{dtype}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{torch}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{half}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{non\PYGZus{}blocking}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{k+kc}{True}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+go}{Linear(in\PYGZus{}features=2, out\PYGZus{}features=2, bias=True)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{linear}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{weight}
\PYG{g+go}{Parameter containing:}
\PYG{g+go}{tensor([[ 0.1914, \PYGZhy{}0.3420],}
\PYG{g+go}{        [\PYGZhy{}0.5112, \PYGZhy{}0.2324]], dtype=torch.float16, device=\PYGZsq{}cuda:1\PYGZsq{})}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{cpu} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{torch}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{device}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{cpu}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{linear}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{to}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{cpu}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+go}{Linear(in\PYGZus{}features=2, out\PYGZus{}features=2, bias=True)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{linear}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{weight}
\PYG{g+go}{Parameter containing:}
\PYG{g+go}{tensor([[ 0.1914, \PYGZhy{}0.3420],}
\PYG{g+go}{        [\PYGZhy{}0.5112, \PYGZhy{}0.2324]], dtype=torch.float16)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{fulllineitems}

\item {}

\item {}

\item {}

\item {}

\item {}

Dumps can be made at each evaluation iteration.
If None, do not dump model automatically.

\item {}

\paragraph{Factories}
\label{\detokenize{api/training:module-geology.metamodelling.factories}}\label{\detokenize{api/training:factories}}\index{geology.metamodelling.factories (module)@\spxentry{geology.metamodelling.factories}\spxextra{module}}
Tools for fast custom module creation.
\index{sequential\_factory() (in module geology.metamodelling.factories)@\spxentry{sequential\_factory()}\spxextra{in module geology.metamodelling.factories}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/training:geology.metamodelling.factories.sequential_factory}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{sequential\_factory}}}{\emph{n}, \emph{conv\_module}, \emph{in\_ch}, \emph{ch}, \emph{*args}, \emph{use\_norm=True}, \emph{use\_nonlin=True}, \emph{residual\_connections=()}, \emph{wrappers=(\textless{}class \textquotesingle{}geology.metamodelling.custom\_blocks.wrappers.MultiInputSequential\textquotesingle{}\textgreater{}}, \emph{\textless{}class \textquotesingle{}geology.metamodelling.custom\_blocks.wrappers.TimeInvariantWrapper\textquotesingle{}\textgreater{})}, \emph{**kwargs}}{}
Helper for creation of sequential modules. Module is constructed based on the chosen \sphinxtitleref{conv\_module}.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{n}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#int}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}}) \textendash{} Number of conv\_modules to stack.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{conv\_module}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{nn.Module}}) \textendash{} Base module from which sequential is constructed.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{in\_ch}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#int}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}}) \textendash{} Number of input channels in the resulting sequential.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{ch}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#int}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#list}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list}}}) \textendash{} Number of output channels in each of \sphinxtitleref{conv\_module\textasciigrave{}s.
If \textasciigrave{}int} is passed, will use similar number of output channels across the modules.
If \sphinxtitleref{list} is passed, use it’s entries. List should have length n.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{args}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#tuple}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{tuple}}}) \textendash{} Any additional args passed to the constructor of {\color{red}\bfseries{}\textasciigrave{}}conv\_module’
Each arg should be either list or any. If arg is not a list, use similar values across modules.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{use\_norm}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#bool}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{nn.Module}}) \textendash{} If bool, marks the need of using normalization between modules (before the nonlin).
If nn.Module, uses this module as a normalization.
Default: True

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{use\_nonlin}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#bool}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{nn.Module}}) \textendash{} If bool, marks the need of using nonlinearity between modules.
If nn.Module, uses this module as a nonlinearity.
Default: True

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{residual\_connections}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#tuple}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{tuple}}}) \textendash{} Tuple of pairs. Each pair marks which layers should be connected.
If pair (i, j) is given, connects the input of i\sphinxhyphen{}th layer and the output of j\sphinxhyphen{}th layer.
Pairs should not cross each other.
Default: ()

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{wrappers}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#tuple}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{tuple}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#list}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list}}}) \textendash{} List of wrappers, which will be used after constructing the composing modules. Order matters.
Default: (MultiInputSequential, TimeInvariantWrapper)

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{kwargs}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#dict}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{dict}}}) \textendash{} Any additional named args passed to the constructor of {\color{red}\bfseries{}\textasciigrave{}}conv\_module’
Each kwarg value should be either list or any. If value is not a list, use similar values across modules.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstylestrong{out} \textendash{} Composed modules, possibly with applied norm, nonlin, wrappers.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#list}{list}, nn.Module

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{lr\_lambda() (in module geology.metamodelling.utils)@\spxentry{lr\_lambda()}\spxextra{in module geology.metamodelling.utils}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{api/training:geology.metamodelling.utils.lr_lambda}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{lr\_lambda}}}{\emph{epoch}, \emph{base=0.99}, \emph{exponent=0.05}}{}
Multiplier used for learning rate scheduling.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
